aggregates
max
max Maximum value aggregate

refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: AQL% SELECT max(attribute) FROM array GROUP BY dimension_1,dimension_2,...

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The max aggregate takes a set of scalar values from an array attribute and returns the maximum value. You can optionally specify one or more dimensions to group by.

The maximum value of an empty set is NULL. The max of a set that contains only NULL values is also NULL. If the set contains NULL and NOT NULL values, the max aggregate considers only NOT NULL values.

informalexample.para: This example find the maximum value of each row of a 2-dimensional array.

step.para:
Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Select the maximum value of each row of m3x3:
AFL% aggregate(m3x3,max(val),i); [(2),(5),(8)]
